oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James Cameron (1817-1882)
Cameron, James, portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Studio photograph of a dark haired man with receding hairline standing next to a curtain with his right hand on the curved back of a chair.

This portrait by an unknown photographer shows Scottish-born artist James Cameron at the approximate age of forty, about the time he would have been working in Tennessee. Cameron's portraits and landscapes dating from the 1850s record settings in and around Chattanooga, Knoxville, and Nashville. One of his most important patrons was James A. Whiteside, a wealthy Chattanooga industrialist and railroad investor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Artists; Cameron, James, 1817-1882; Portraits; Whiteside, James A.
Walking a Fine Line
